reviews.sentence: I stay at this property on a regular basis and this trip my room needed two small maintenance items. Both items were resolved immediately with a single request the staff are friendly and more importantly responsive to guest requests.

Great hotel for One Night. I booked four rooms for one night for family members driving from out of town for my sons wedding reception. We were upgraded to the 6th floor and received free breakfasts. The rooms are old and needs renovation but the bedding was awesome. The duvets and pillows were comfy. Our rooms had a small fridge and microwave. Bonus was the parking and wifi. They were Free. This is rare nowadays in the OC. Overnight parking runs around 30 to 40 a night in most Newport Beach hotels. This hotel is close to the airport and restaurants. The front desk people are very helpful and friendly. The pool was decent. The bar inside was also nice. The breakfast buffet was okay and you can even order your eggs a la carte if you do not care for the scrambled eggs. I would stay here again.
Paint peeling bathroom door faucet leaked. Sloppy paint job bathroom could use updating. Staff was excellent.

NOT A HAPPY BIRTHDAY WEEKEND. BEWARE THE AIRPORT NOISE LEVEL IS SERIOUS IF YOUR ROOM IS ON AIRPORT SIDE OF BLDG. Our very 1st night AT RADISON SERIOUS NOISE FROM MULTIPLE CHECK INS INTO MULTIPLE ROOMS all next to our room NEAR MIDNIGHT include. Loud converstations OUR DOOR. NO HELP FROM SECURITY AFTER WE CALLED FRONT DESK. I had to confront THE SITUATION MY SELF AT MIDNIGHT in the hallway. Also on a separate night DIFFERENT PEOPLE 130 AM A LOUD PARTY in the room next to us. DID GET SOME HELP THIS TIME WITH A PHONE CALL FROM FRONT DESK to that party to shut them down. Then 630 AM after the 130 am party. a MAINTENANCE WORKER was working in the Stairwell attached to our room awakened us out of the brief sleep after the Party Shutdown. the Maintenance worker was going from Floor to Floor ascending to our Top Floor while SLAMMING STAIRWELL DOORS HEAVY BOOT STOMPS all the way up the stairs to our room. I got out of bed into the hallway to see what was this craziness all about. As the worker exited the stairwell into the hallway next to our Room door he SLAMMED THE HEAVY METAL FIRE DOOR and in a GRUFF ANGRY MOOD walked right past me like he was on a Mission. AS I ASKED HIM WHY SO MUCH NOISE. Not a happy camper. Not our Favorite Hotel. Especially when you consider that AFTER CHECK OUT our Paper Receipt CORRECT WAS NOT THE SAME AMOUNT OUR CREDIT CARD WAS CHARGED. We were OVER CHARGED 100. it took 30 min. on the phone with 3 different front desk people before I could get help from anyone who knew HOW TO PUT THROUGH A CREDIT OF 100 TO OUR CR CRD. FYI STILL WAITING ON THAT CREDIT TO SHOW UP.

Great hotel in a great location if you can deal with the planes. I have spent quite a bit of time at this hotel for business. The pool is one of my favorites. it is heated and large enough to get a good work out doing some laps. The whirlpool next to it is also awesome great place to unwind or prepare for the day. The fitness facility is also nicely equipped with multiple treadmills freweights up to 50lbs a few cable machines towels and water. I also really love the location. it is just a short drive down to Newport Beach and easy to get on the 405. And unlike a few other hotels in the area you do not have to pay for parking which you should always factor into the overall cost of the stay. But just a couple of points it is literally right next to the John Wayne airport runway. I do not mind the noise too much. The flights stop around 100PM and start around 630AM. So if you are light sleeper you may want to seriously reconsider. I quite like watching the planes take off and land. The second point is that the hotel is a bit dated though they are currently undergoing updates. so there are some oddities such as the plugs which are too far from the nightstands to plug your phone in sliding doors that do not quite slide anymore decor more fitting 1 or 2 decades ago. The third is that the showerheads in the bathroom do not allow very much adjustment. I am 510 and find it awkward to use. If you are taller you will be bending down to wash your head. Overall for me I think if you can get a good deal here it is not a bad place to stay as long as you can deal with the planes.

Tired Hotel planned upgrade can not come soon enough. Hotel is in desperate need for an upgrade. All facilities are dated and in need of a facelift. A planned upgrade can not come soon enough. Located near the John Wayne Airport in Irvine you could be misled name of the hotel as it is a long distance from the beach. Only bright spot was the friendly staff in Saphire Lounge.

Total dump in midst of renovation basically a construction site. Do not stay here place is undergoing major renovation which it clearly needs but in the meantime it is a total dump. Promise me do not stay here. Hopefully it will be nice when done but now you check in in a makeshift lobby and it gets worse from there.

Under Construction. Nice Staff but a lot of noise. Between being directly across the street from the airport and the jack hammers tearing out concrete is was loud. It is a very old and outdated hotel in the middle of a complete and much nede overhaul.

There was loud construction and everyone was weird. Nice pillows. Nice. and the wine ended up having gone bad. Housekeeping ignored the do not disturb sign at an early hour on the day we were checking out. I wish you could say you get what you pay for but this was incredibly overpriced for what we were given. got to our which took surprisingly long considering we were two of four patrons and there are only two wines. We then bolted out of the extremely brightly lit We were greeted by two nice ladies but all of the computers were down upon check in so the process was an actual process. in retrospect this could have been our first sign. APPARENTLY they are renovating on a holiday weekend in the morning loudly. After being told that they were out of our first two choices of wine we ordered some sort of wine at the hotel.

Disappointing. the name. was dirty. Will not book there again. was horrible it would turn hot then cold and the carpet in the the hotel was in renovation most elevators were not working plumbing in the.

A great surprise. Amazing hotel contemporary clean simple lines wonderful room very feng shui they did a awesome renovation on the hotel. Staff was wonderful. The bar needs music dim the lights and have a cozier seating area. Will stay here again. A great price that can not be beat.

Rooms were recently remodeled and are very nice. Good layout and furniture amazing tv. Wish it were a little larger but only because were travelling with lots of baby stuff. Bathroom is really nice especially the shower and fixtures. TP holder in a weird spot. Free parking is a huge plus and the staff have been all very nice so far. Definitely recommend.

Hotel is renovated and the new room design is modern and the same time comfortable. Our room was very clean bed very comfortable and sheets smelled on fresh laundry detergent. I was happy with the choice I made to stay there.

Short getaway. Loved this place. My daughter and her good friend were going to a concert and wanted to be central to a certain area. We choose this hotel because location and price. It was pleasant surpise. Newly remodeled very clean and such comfortable beds. Great staff. It was by far the biggest bang for our buck.

Recently refurbished very comfy beds and pillows helpful and friendly staff giant TV. They could use some more lights in the room and the clock in the bathroom is wrong and embedded in the mirror so no obvious way to adjust it. Overall excellent. I recommend.
Great newly renovated property.

The front staff was surprising for how nicely renovated and updated this hotel is. First they did nt acknowledge I was there then the employee had my credit card inserted chip out and could nt understand why it would nt read and better yet did nt activate the room card so I had to return to lobby where second employee treated me as if I did nt know what I was talking about until I was like the front door blinks yellow and red not green. The pool and spa are nice but be aware that it is right next to where their business meeting and dinner areas are so it can lessen evening relaxation even if nice that they keep it open late and with towels to use. Lastly be aware that shuttle is highly disorganized. They do nt keep a sign up list drivers do nt announce when leaving and in my case drivers switch itineraries meaning you have to get out in Irvine and Uber when you are trying for airport and the driver is heading elsewhere but wo nt tell you where. The hotel did nt ever contact me either.
Best value for money I would highly recommend. Bathroom renovations shower was excellent cofemaker and auto lights online checkout.

Stayed here 2 weeks on business. Nice hotel. Very friendly staff. Place is very clean and seems updated and well maintained. Bar restaurant pool and fitness center are all decent and about average or a little above average for this type of hotel. Stayed 2 weeks and seemed pretty quiet. Very close to airport but other than that there is not much near the hotel to do. A few restaurants but no grocery stores or activities. This seems like a fly in fly out type of place. It is in a business district so no nightlife. Newport beach is about a 30 minute car ride and cost about 15 each way to Newport Beach with Uber. My daughter stayed with us one night and oddly the hotel had no roll away beds but they did bring extra pillows and blankets so she could make a nest on the floor to sleep.

Love the hotel. Convenient location 6 7 min from ocean. Hotel is our personal fave to stay at when in Newport Beach. It has been remodeled and has modern finishings thru out. The staff is always great. Breakfast is nice but expensive for the buffet. Parking is FREE which is a HUGE bonus for us as we do not like to pay additional for self parking as many hotels tack on that fee. Internet is good easy to connect. Hotel is always very clean. Weekends tend to be cheaper rates than weekdays. Good Value overall.
